content: What body organ removes waste from your blood and produces urine?

The body organ responsible for removing waste from the blood and producing urine is the kidney. You have two kidneys, located on either side of your spine, just below the rib cage. They filter your blood multiple times a day, removing waste products and excess fluids, which are then excreted as urine. The kidneys also play a crucial role in regulating electrolytes, maintaining acid-base balance, and producing hormones that help control blood pressure and red blood cell production.
